definition[0]: slightly fat in a fairly pleasant way – used especially about women or children, often to avoid saying the word ‘fat’
example[0]: The nurse was a cheerful plump woman.
definition[1]: round and full in a way that looks attractive
definition[2]: to gently hit cushions or pillows in order to make them rounder and softer
definition[3]: to put something down suddenly and carelessly
example[4]: Plump the bags down anywhere you like.
definition[4]: if dried fruit plumps up, or if you plump it up, it becomes fatter and softer when in liquid
example[5]: Soak the apricots and raisins until the fruit plumps up.
